intro: Horkelia pilosa, commonly known as the hairy horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Horkelia pilosa is often found in arid or semi-arid regions, where it has adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
